Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: nuxt

Arguments.Name: start
Arguments.Description: Start the production server (after running nuxt build). Use it for Node.js hosting like Heroku, Digital Ocean, etc

Arguments.Name: generate
Arguments.Description: Build the application (if needed), generate every route as a HTML file and statically export to dist/ directory (used for static hosting)

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Build and optimize your application with webpack for production

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Bundle name to inspect. (client, server, modern)

Arguments.Name: --dev
Arguments.Description: Inspect webpack config for dev mode

Arguments.Name: --depth
Arguments.Description: Inspection depth. Defaults to 2 to prevent verbose output

Arguments.Name: --no-colors
Arguments.Description: Disable ANSI colors (disabled by default when TTY is not available or when piping to a file)
